result.execSummary:
The defendant Bulent Perktas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bulent  Perktas in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hicri Koroglu interpreter sworn.

Plea Colloquy.

Defendant enters an alford guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld Sentence of:

Term of Probation: 3 Years - Stayed for 10 days to return to Turkey

Conditions of Probation:
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No unmonitored contact with anyone under the age of 18 .

Defendant to register as sex offender

FINE: $9793.00 BAIL TO APPLY
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00  BAIL TO APPLY
DNA Sample ordered
(Remaining $43.00 to be paid within 24 hours)
Court releases surety bond.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given. Body armor warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bulent Perktas in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.  Brian Juechappeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Fred Schahlapour sworn.

Court passes case for Atty. to speak with client regarding his plea.  Case recalled at 3:27.  Atty. Levine requests new date for plea and sentencing.  Statements by interpreter.
Court will look for a different certified interpreter.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Bulent Perktas in court with attorney Michael G. Levine.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Fred Schalapour sworn.  Case remains as scheduled.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

No access to the internet and no use of any electronic device. No contact with any minor children. Passport to remain with the Department of Justice. Defendant to remain in the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program in person at least 2 times a week. He must report the 1st business day of his release to WCS.  Is to reside  Waukesha or Milwaukee Counties during the pendency of the court proceeding. He is not to leave the State of Wisconsin unless he has permission from the Court. Defendant must post $10,000.00 cash and sign a co-sign bond with a family member that resides in the USA and must provide proof of that. Co-sign bond to be in the amount of $20,000.00.

Defendant Bulent Perktas in court, in custody, with attorney Michael G. Levine.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Fred Shahlapour interpreter appears. Interpreter is sworn. Defendant stated that he does not understand the court appointed interpreter. Defendant's relative Mr. Gazioglu helps to interpret. Interpreter Fred Shahlapour sat at the defense table, but did not intrepret.  Special Agent Taubel was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments and moves for dismissal. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Defendant will need interpreter. 
Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects to any bail modification.  Arraignment scheduled for October 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
